quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Title and City
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, brodway, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which part of the world is commonly described as Far East?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East and Southeast Asia

questions.question: Which is a major US airline and a subsidiary of Delta Air Lines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northwest Airlines

questions.question: During the Cold War, which city was the capital of West Germany?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bonn

questions.question: Which was the first TV sitcom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Kay and Johnny

questions.question: Which use of  the term Wild West is incorrect?

options.text: Wild West is the title of several Western movies
Wild West is a Nintendo game
Wild West was a common name for territories west of the Rio Grande river
Wild West is an album of Dottie West

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wild West was a common name for territories west of the Rio Grande river

questions.question: This 1980 film by French director Alan Resnais features Gerard Depardieu in a starring role.  The translation of the title in English is loosely:  My Uncle is....
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... An American.

questions.question: Complete the title to this 1989 Wayne Wang comedy:  Life is Cheap...

options.text: ... Dont Spend It All in One Place.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... But Toilet Paper is Expensive.

questions.question: Which distinction does Annie Moore hold?

options.text: She was the first American woman to win a Nobel Prize.
She was the first immigrant  to the USA to pass through Ellis Island.
She was the first American woman to be a dentist.
She was the first American woman to graduate from college.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was the first immigrant  to the USA to pass through Ellis Island.

questions.question: What distinction does Sir Timothy Berners-Lee hold?

options.text: He was the first RAF pilot to shoot down a plane.
He is the inventor of the World Wide Web.
He made  the first cell phone call.
He was the first non-American to hold a US patent.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is the inventor of the World Wide Web.

questions.question: Which was the first womens college in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mt. Holyoke

questions.question: The plot of the famous Brodway musical West Side Story is based on which source?

options.text: The musical is a classical western
A true story of two Los Angeles teenage gangs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shakespears Romeo and Juliet

questions.question: In what city was the popular TV series EastEnders set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: London

questions.question: Who was the first person to parachute?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andres-Jacques Garnerin

questions.question: Complete the title of this 1993 comedy, directed by Eric Schaffer:  My Lifes...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... in Turnaround.

questions.question: Which of the following actors did not appear in the 1996 film Trees Lounge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Ruffalo

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: World and Village
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, toe, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which one of these sciences is the TOE theory studied?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Physics

questions.question: This invention that forever altered the development of the American West was patented in 1874 by American farmer Joseph Glidden.

options.text: The scanning disk for future TV sets

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbed wire

questions.question: If the world were a village of 100 people, how many would be female?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 52

questions.question: Which word refers to self-discipline and refraining from worldly pleasures?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asceticism

questions.question: Which is an existing country, recognized by United Nations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East Timor

questions.question: If the world were a village of 100 people, how many would be white?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 18

questions.question: Which US city is nicknamed The Venice of  America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fort Lauderdale, Florida

questions.question: Which part of the Earth is made up of iron mixed with nickel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The outer core

questions.question: The Hall-Héroult chemical process is used for the production of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aluminum

questions.question: In the summer of 2006, environmental consultant Mark Diacono planted the first olive grove in England. He claimed that olives can already grow in England for what reason?

options.text: The extension of the European Union

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Global warming

questions.question: In the music fields Frenchman Francois Tourte is famous for what?

options.text: He invented the saxophone in collaboration with Adolphe Sax.
He standardized the size of the violin bow.
He won the first Gorbachov International Music Award
He was one of the first prominent saxophonists of the 19th century.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He standardized the size of the violin bow.

questions.question: Which one of these is among the Top Ten Inventions of 2005 according to the US Army?

options.text: The G.A.D.G.E.T. Deployable armored personnel vehicle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fido Explosives Detector

questions.question: Who is the author of the novel East of Eden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Steinbeck

questions.question: Where is Western University located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baku, Azerbaijan

questions.question: Which cities were the original endpoints of the Orient Express railway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris and Istanbul

questions.question: What term means fear of accidents?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 86

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 50

questions.question: What word means fear of heights?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Batophobia

questions.question: If the world were a village of 100 people, how many would be homosexual?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 11

questions.question: If the world were a village of 100 people, how many people would possess 59% of the worlds wealth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: If the world were a village of 100 people, how many would be of other religious beliefs besides Christianity?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Salt and Fear
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, condition, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What astronaut or cosmonaut performed the first space walk on March 18, 1965?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonov

questions.question: What phobia is described as fear of marriage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gamophobia

questions.question: What is the daily salt intake recommended by the Scientific Advisory Committee on Nutrition for the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 grams

questions.question: What chemical is added to table salt in some European countries to prevent tooth decay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sodium fluoride

questions.question: Excessive salt consumption can lead to high blood pressure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the basic chemical compound that table salt is composed of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sodium chloride

questions.question: What is Fleur de sel?

options.text: A species of seaweed that live only in sea water with very high salinity
A plant that contains the highest amount of sodium chloride of all plants
A type of salty French biscuits

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natural sea salt

questions.question: There are two main sources of salt - sea water and rock salt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these condiments has a high salt content and can pretty much fulfill the need for table salt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What term means fear of fish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ichthyophobia

questions.question: Which of these medical conditions is linked to excessive salt consumption?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What condition is characterized by fear of men?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hominophobia

questions.question: Which of these chemical compounds is added to table salt as an anti-caking agent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Some of the most persecuted people in history, they trace their origins to northwestern India or present day Pakistan. The Nazis killed as many as 400,000 of them.  By the 1400s they had spread across Asia Minor and into Egypt, Spain and Germany.  Who are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Roma

questions.question: Potassium iodide, sodium iodide, or sodium iodate are added to table salt in order to prevent iodine deficiency. What health problems does iodine deficiency cause?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thyroid gland disorders

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Series and South Africa
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, summer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Can you name the 2004 television series the following quote is from: Me and 4,399 of my closest friends popped out of a ball of light right about here.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The 4400

questions.question: According to geologists, in which era do we live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cenozoic

questions.question: Every summer, a special basketball tournament is held in Harlem, NY.  What is the original name of the tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rucker Tournament

questions.question: What are the names of George Costanzas parents on the TV show Seinfeld?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank and Estelle

questions.question: This 2002 television series followed the lives of 3 families over 4 generations. The Keys, the Crawfords, and the Clarkes were all somehow linked with various alien encounters over the years and the culmination of all this was the birth of Allison Clarke played by Dakota Fanning.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taken

questions.question: This American professional basketball player, nicknamed The Pearl, was known for his flamboyant dribbling and play-making.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earl Monroe

questions.question: This Harvard dropouts first acting role was in Mystic Pizza, in 1988.  He lived next door to historian, Howard Zinn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matt Damon

questions.question: This 1975 television movie, starring James Earl Jones and Estelle Parsons, was based on the supposed abduction in 1961 of an inter racial couple living in New Hampshire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The UFO Incident

questions.question: The actor who voiced Betty Boop also voiced Popeye.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which countrys blue division helped Germany on the Eastern front during WWII?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spain

questions.question: The term bibliobibuli refers to people who do what?

options.text: Use a lot of toilet paper

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Read too much

questions.question: In his twelve-volume analysis, this British historian wrote that history was not a continuous climb upward, but a series of  waves or pulses, where civilizations rise, prosper and eventually fall.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold J. Toynbee

questions.question: According to articles published in the Journal of American Folklore and the Journal of UFO Studies, abductions generally follow a specific sequence, although most dont involve all of these elements. The sequence is as follows: Capture, Examination, Conference, Tour, Loss of Time, Return, Theophany and Aftermath.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1836, German-Dutch farmers in South Africa moved north east through South Africa to establish a colony.  What did they call this march?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Trek

questions.question: Cardinal Richelieu, the bad guy in many of the works of Dumas, was a brilliant minister for which king?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XIII

They are UN controlled islands in the Atlantic.
They are sites of famous WWII battles.

options.text: To be rather than to seem
